parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Identity

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set person's face. For a list of available faces, check [[:Category:CfgIdentities]].

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> person '''setFace''' face

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> person: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> face: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>soldier1 [[setFace]] "WhiteHead_02"</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Set persistent face for a unit in MP<code>[[if]] ([[isServer]]) [[then]] {[_unit, "AsianHead_A3_02"] [[remoteExec]] ["setFace", 0, _unit]};</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[face]], [[setIdentity]], [[setSpeaker]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on unknown</dd>
<dt class="note">unknown</dt>
<dd class="note">
For '''Arma 2''' the face value is a string from ''Face01'' to ''Face107''. Camo faces are available as well, 6 per face.  For example the full set of class names for face value 77 would be:
  Face77, Face77_camo1, Face77_camo2, Face77_camo3, Face77_camo4, Face77_camo5 and Face77_camo6
----
* [http://www.ofpec.com/forum/index.php?topic=33444.0 a full list of Arma 2 faces]
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
